00:00:02:030000.Scene: Opening shows some scenes from the final episode of the previous season, followed by the caption “Three months later.” Scene then opens in lobby, with the guys arriving home from the North Pole. All have long hair and bushy beards except Sheldon, whose hair is slightly longer and who has a goatee.
00:00:02:030000.Speaker: Sheldon
00:00:02:030000.Dialogue: I am going to the Arctic Circle with Leonard, Wolowitz and Koothrappali.

00:00:05:190000.Scene: Opening shows some scenes from the final episode of the previous season, followed by the caption “Three months later.” Scene then opens in lobby, with the guys arriving home from the North Pole. All have long hair and bushy beards except Sheldon, whose hair is slightly longer and who has a goatee.
00:00:05:190000.Speaker: Penny

00:00:08:020000.Scene: Opening shows some scenes from the final episode of the previous season, followed by the caption “Three months later.” Scene then opens in lobby, with the guys arriving home from the North Pole. All have long hair and bushy beards except Sheldon, whose hair is slightly longer and who has a goatee.
00:00:08:020000.Speaker: Leonard
00:00:08:020000.Dialogue: What did you mean when you said you were going to miss me?

00:00:13:070000.Scene: Opening shows some scenes from the final episode of the previous season, followed by the caption “Three months later.” Scene then opens in lobby, with the guys arriving home from the North Pole. All have long hair and bushy beards except Sheldon, whose hair is slightly longer and who has a goatee.
00:00:13:070000.Speaker: Penny
00:00:13:070000.Dialogue: It means I wish you weren't going.

00:00:30:030000.Scene: Opening shows some scenes from the final episode of the previous season, followed by the caption “Three months later.” Scene then opens in lobby, with the guys arriving home from the North Pole. All have long hair and bushy beards except Sheldon, whose hair is slightly longer and who has a goatee.
00:00:30:030000.Speaker: Leonard

00:00:31:140000.Scene: Opening shows some scenes from the final episode of the previous season, followed by the caption “Three months later.” Scene then opens in lobby, with the guys arriving home from the North Pole. All have long hair and bushy beards except Sheldon, whose hair is slightly longer and who has a goatee.
00:00:31:140000.Speaker: Howard
00:00:31:140000.Dialogue: I can't believe we spent three months in that frozen hell.

00:00:35:180000.Scene: Opening shows some scenes from the final episode of the previous season, followed by the caption “Three months later.” Scene then opens in lobby, with the guys arriving home from the North Pole. All have long hair and bushy beards except Sheldon, whose hair is slightly longer and who has a goatee.
00:00:35:180000.Speaker: Raj
00:00:35:180000.Dialogue: It was like a snowy nightmare from which there was no awakening.

00:00:39:210000.Scene: Opening shows some scenes from the final episode of the previous season, followed by the caption “Three months later.” Scene then opens in lobby, with the guys arriving home from the North Pole. All have long hair and bushy beards except Sheldon, whose hair is slightly longer and who has a goatee.
00:00:39:210000.Speaker: Sheldon
00:00:39:210000.Dialogue: I don't know what Arctic expedition you guys were on, but I thought it was a hoot and a half.

00:00:47:220000.Scene: The apartment door. Sheldon is on the phone.
00:00:47:220000.Speaker: Sheldon
00:00:47:220000.Dialogue: Hi, Mom. I told you I'd call you when I got home. I'm not home yet.

00:00:54:160000.Scene: The apartment door. Sheldon is on the phone.
00:00:54:160000.Speaker: Sheldon

00:00:57:110000.Scene: The apartment door. Sheldon is on the phone.
00:00:57:110000.Speaker: Sheldon
00:00:57:110000.Dialogue: The Arctic expedition was a remarkable success. I'm all but certain there's a Nobel Prize in my future. Actually, I shouldn't say that. I'm entirely certain.

00:01:07:200000.Scene: The apartment door. Sheldon is on the phone.
00:01:07:200000.Speaker: Sheldon
00:01:07:200000.Dialogue: No, Mother, I could not feel your church group praying for my safety.

00:01:12:090000.Scene: The apartment door. Sheldon is on the phone.
00:01:12:090000.Speaker: Sheldon
00:01:12:090000.Dialogue: The fact that I'm home safe doesn't prove it worked. That logic is post hoc ergo propter hoc.

00:01:18:120000.Scene: The apartment door. Sheldon is on the phone.
00:01:18:120000.Speaker: Sheldon
00:01:18:120000.Dialogue: No, I'm not sassing you in Eskimo talk.

00:01:22:230000.Scene: The apartment door. Sheldon is on the phone.
00:01:22:230000.Speaker: Leonard
00:01:22:230000.Dialogue: I'm gonna let Penny know we're back.

00:01:24:150000.Scene: The apartment door. Sheldon is on the phone.
00:01:24:150000.Speaker: Sheldon
00:01:24:150000.Dialogue: Mother, I have to go. Love you. Bye. Hello, old friend.

00:01:39:160000.Scene: The apartment door. Sheldon is on the phone.
00:01:39:160000.Speaker: Sheldon

00:01:45:180000.Speaker: Leonard
00:01:45:180000.Dialogue: I just stopped by to say...

00:02:03:090000.Speaker: Howard
00:02:03:090000.Dialogue: Damn it, I should have gone over and told her we were back.

00:02:40:180000.Speaker: Sheldon
00:02:40:180000.Dialogue: I just want you both to know, when I publish my findings, I won't forget your contributions.

00:02:47:150000.Speaker: Sheldon
00:02:47:150000.Dialogue: Of course, I can't mention you in my Nobel acceptance speech, but when I get around to writing my memoirs, you can expect a very effusive footnote and perhaps a signed copy.

00:03:04:030000.Speaker: Sheldon
00:03:04:030000.Dialogue: You fellows are planning a party for me, aren't you?

00:03:09:210000.Speaker: Sheldon
00:03:09:210000.Dialogue: If there's going to be a theme, I should let you know that I don't care for luau, toga or "under the sea."

00:03:17:070000.Speaker: Howard
00:03:17:070000.Dialogue: Yeah, we'll keep that in mind. Look... We need to talk to you about something that happened at the North Pole.

00:03:23:220000.Speaker: Sheldon
00:03:23:220000.Dialogue: If this is about the night the heat went out, there's nothing to be embarrassed about.

00:03:30:020000.Speaker: Howard
00:03:30:020000.Dialogue: - We agreed to never speak of it again.

00:03:38:080000.Speaker: Sheldon
00:03:38:080000.Dialogue: It was only to keep our core body temperatures from plummeting.

00:03:45:000000.Speaker: Raj
00:03:45:000000.Dialogue: For me, it was a bonding moment.

00:03:51:080000.Speaker: Howard
00:03:51:080000.Dialogue: Sheldon, you remember the first few weeks we were looking for magnetic monopoles and not finding anything and you were acting like an obnoxious, giant dictator?

00:04:01:230000.Speaker: Raj
00:04:01:230000.Dialogue: We were gonna be gentle with him.

00:04:10:130000.Speaker: Howard
00:04:10:130000.Dialogue: And when we finally got our first positive data, you were so happy.

00:04:15:130000.Speaker: Sheldon
00:04:15:130000.Dialogue: In the world of emoticons, I was colon, capital "D."

00:04:25:040000.Speaker: Howard
00:04:25:040000.Dialogue: Well, in actuality, what your equipment detected wasn't so much evidence of paradigm-shifting monopoles as it was... static from the electric can opener we were turning on and off.

00:04:47:230000.Speaker: Raj
00:04:47:230000.Dialogue: It was the only way to keep you from being such a huge Dickensian.

00:04:53:010000.Speaker: Raj
00:04:53:010000.Dialogue: You see that? I add the "ensian. "

00:04:57:020000.Speaker: Sheldon
00:04:57:020000.Dialogue: Did Leonard know about this? Leonard's my best friend in the world. Surely Leonard didn't know.

00:05:02:230000.Speaker: Sheldon
00:05:02:230000.Dialogue: Of course it was. The whole plan reeks of Leonard.

00:05:09:040000.Speaker: Penny
00:05:09:040000.Dialogue: I couldn't think of anyone else while you were gone.

00:05:11:080000.Speaker: Leonard
00:05:11:080000.Dialogue: Me, neither. Except for one night when the heat went out. Long story. Don't ask.

00:05:37:070000.Speaker: Leonard
00:05:37:070000.Dialogue: Damn his Vulcan hearing. Not a good time, Sheldon.

00:05:49:140000.Speaker: Sheldon
00:05:49:140000.Dialogue: - Hello. I realize you're currently at the mercy of your primitive biological urges, but as you have an entire lifetime of poor decisions ahead of you, may I interrupt this one?

00:06:00:190000.Speaker: Penny
00:06:00:190000.Dialogue: It's great to see you too. Come on in.

00:06:03:100000.Speaker: Sheldon
00:06:03:100000.Dialogue: Wolowitz has informed me of your grand deception. Do you have anything to say for yourself?

00:06:08:150000.Speaker: Leonard
00:06:08:150000.Dialogue: Yes, I feel terrible about it. I will never forgive myself, I don't expect you to, either, and I would really appreciate it if you would leave me with Penny for a session of self-criticism and repentance.

00:06:22:210000.Speaker: Penny
00:06:22:210000.Dialogue: Can someone please tell me what's going on here?

00:06:25:030000.Speaker: Sheldon
00:06:25:030000.Dialogue: What's going on is I was led to believe I was making groundbreaking strides in science, when in fact, I was being fed false data at the hands of Wolowitz, Koothrappali and your furry little boy toy.

00:06:39:090000.Speaker: Leonard
00:06:39:090000.Dialogue: It was the only way to make him happy.

00:06:43:130000.Speaker: Leonard
00:06:43:130000.Dialogue: When he wasn't happy, we wanted to kill him.

00:06:50:140000.Speaker: Leonard
00:06:50:140000.Dialogue: We were going to throw his Kindle outside, when he went to get it, lock the door and let him freeze to death.

00:06:57:120000.Speaker: Sheldon
00:06:57:120000.Dialogue: That seems like a bit of an overreaction.

00:07:00:010000.Speaker: Leonard
00:07:00:010000.Dialogue: The overreaction was the plan to tie your limbs to four different sled dog teams and yell, "Mush. "

00:07:07:200000.Speaker: Leonard
00:07:07:200000.Dialogue: We kept the original data. You can still publish the actual results.

00:07:11:210000.Speaker: Sheldon
00:07:11:210000.Dialogue: Yes, but the actual results are unsuccessful and I've already sent an e-mail to everyone at the university explaining that I have confirmed string theory and forever changed man's understanding of the universe.

00:07:22:030000.Speaker: Leonard
00:07:22:030000.Dialogue: Aw, see, yeah, you probably shouldn't have done that.

00:07:26:060000.Speaker: Leonard
00:07:26:060000.Dialogue: So write another e-mail. Set the record straight. No big deal.

00:07:31:070000.Speaker: Sheldon
00:07:31:070000.Dialogue: You're right, Leonard. It's not a big deal. All you did was lie to me, destroy my dream and humiliate me in front of the whole university. That, FYI, was sarcasm.

00:07:46:130000.Speaker: Sheldon
00:07:46:130000.Dialogue: I, in fact, believe it is a big deal.

00:07:57:050000.Speaker: Leonard
00:07:57:050000.Dialogue: He'll be fine. The guy's a trouper. Come here.

00:08:01:030000.Speaker: Penny
00:08:01:030000.Dialogue: You're right, you shouldn't talk to him. I will.

00:08:06:110000.Speaker: Leonard
00:08:06:110000.Dialogue: Man, I cannot catch a break.

00:08:17:030000.Scene: Sheldon’s bedroom. Penny knocks and enters.
00:08:17:030000.Speaker: Penny

00:08:18:180000.Scene: Sheldon’s bedroom. Penny knocks and enters.
00:08:18:180000.Speaker: Sheldon
00:08:18:180000.Dialogue: About what? Being betrayed by my friends? Spending three months at the North Pole for nothing? And I didn't even get to go to Comic-Con!

00:08:32:140000.Scene: Sheldon’s bedroom. Penny knocks and enters.
00:08:32:140000.Speaker: Penny

00:08:40:160000.Scene: Sheldon’s bedroom. Penny knocks and enters.
00:08:40:160000.Speaker: Penny

00:08:43:180000.Scene: Sheldon’s bedroom. Penny knocks and enters.
00:08:43:180000.Speaker: Sheldon
00:08:43:180000.Dialogue: That's for when I'm sick. Sad is not sick.

00:08:46:220000.Scene: Sheldon’s bedroom. Penny knocks and enters.
00:08:46:220000.Speaker: Penny
00:08:46:220000.Dialogue: Sorry. I don't know your sad song.

00:08:49:030000.Scene: Sheldon’s bedroom. Penny knocks and enters.
00:08:49:030000.Speaker: Sheldon
00:08:49:030000.Dialogue: I don't have a sad song. I'm not a child.

00:08:54:000000.Scene: Sheldon’s bedroom. Penny knocks and enters.
00:08:54:000000.Speaker: Penny
00:08:54:000000.Dialogue: You know, I do understand what you're going through.

00:08:57:010000.Scene: Sheldon’s bedroom. Penny knocks and enters.
00:08:57:010000.Speaker: Sheldon
00:08:57:010000.Dialogue: Really? Did you just have the Nobel Prize in waitressing stolen from you?

00:09:02:150000.Scene: Sheldon’s bedroom. Penny knocks and enters.
00:09:02:150000.Speaker: Penny
00:09:02:150000.Dialogue: Well, no, but when I was a senior in high school, one of my friends heard I was gonna be named head cheerleader. I was so excited. My mom even made me a celebration pie. Then they named stupid Valerie Mossbacher head cheerleader. Big ol' slutbag.

00:09:19:180000.Scene: Sheldon’s bedroom. Penny knocks and enters.
00:09:19:180000.Speaker: Sheldon
00:09:19:180000.Dialogue: Are you saying that you think a "celebration pie" is even remotely comparable to a Nobel Prize?

00:09:27:110000.Scene: Sheldon’s bedroom. Penny knocks and enters.
00:09:27:110000.Speaker: Penny

00:09:31:060000.Scene: Sheldon’s bedroom. Penny knocks and enters.
00:09:31:060000.Speaker: Sheldon
00:09:31:060000.Dialogue: And on a different, but not unrelated topic, based on your current efforts to buoy my spirits, do you truly believe that you were ever fit to be a cheerleader?

00:09:47:020000.Scene: Sheldon’s bedroom. Penny knocks and enters.
00:09:47:020000.Speaker: Penny
00:09:47:020000.Dialogue: Look, Sheldon, I just don't think that the guys and Leonard really meant to hurt you. They just told an unfortunate lie to deal with a difficult situation. You know what it's like? Remember that scene in the new Star Trek when Kirk has to take over the ship, so he tells Spock all that stuff he knew wasn't true, like saying Spock didn't care his mom died?

00:10:06:130000.Scene: Sheldon’s bedroom. Penny knocks and enters.
00:10:06:130000.Speaker: Sheldon
00:10:06:130000.Dialogue: I missed Comic-Con and the New Star Trek movie!

00:10:13:150000.Scene: The university cafeteria. The guys have shaved and had haircuts. Howard has kept his moustache.
00:10:13:150000.Speaker: Raj

00:10:19:140000.Scene: The university cafeteria. The guys have shaved and had haircuts. Howard has kept his moustache.
00:10:19:140000.Speaker: Howard

00:10:22:200000.Scene: The university cafeteria. The guys have shaved and had haircuts. Howard has kept his moustache.
00:10:22:200000.Speaker: Raj
00:10:22:200000.Dialogue: I call it "the Mario and Luigi," but whatever.

00:10:27:170000.Scene: The university cafeteria. The guys have shaved and had haircuts. Howard has kept his moustache.
00:10:27:170000.Speaker: Raj

00:10:29:050000.Scene: The university cafeteria. The guys have shaved and had haircuts. Howard has kept his moustache.
00:10:29:050000.Speaker: Leonard
00:10:29:050000.Dialogue: He came out of his room this morning wearing his Darth Vader helmet and tried to choke me to death with the force, so I'd say, "a little better."

00:10:37:100000.Scene: The university cafeteria. The guys have shaved and had haircuts. Howard has kept his moustache.
00:10:37:100000.Speaker: Howard
00:10:37:100000.Dialogue: If I may abruptly change the subject, did you and Penny finally... You know. Personally, I don't care, but my genitals wanted me to ask.

00:10:45:230000.Scene: The university cafeteria. The guys have shaved and had haircuts. Howard has kept his moustache.
00:10:45:230000.Speaker: Leonard
00:10:45:230000.Dialogue: Tell your genitals what I do with Penny is none of their business.

00:10:50:070000.Scene: The university cafeteria. The guys have shaved and had haircuts. Howard has kept his moustache.
00:10:50:070000.Speaker: Howard
00:10:50:070000.Dialogue: He says they didn't do it.

00:10:54:020000.Scene: The university cafeteria. The guys have shaved and had haircuts. Howard has kept his moustache.
00:10:54:020000.Speaker: Leonard

00:11:10:070000.Scene: The university cafeteria. The guys have shaved and had haircuts. Howard has kept his moustache.
00:11:10:070000.Speaker: Howard

00:11:12:180000.Scene: The university cafeteria. The guys have shaved and had haircuts. Howard has kept his moustache.
00:11:12:180000.Speaker: Raj
00:11:12:180000.Dialogue: I feel bad for the guy.

00:11:17:200000.Scene: The university cafeteria. The guys have shaved and had haircuts. Howard has kept his moustache.
00:11:17:200000.Speaker: Leonard
00:11:17:200000.Dialogue: Sheldon, why are you sitting by yourself?

00:11:19:230000.Scene: The university cafeteria. The guys have shaved and had haircuts. Howard has kept his moustache.
00:11:19:230000.Speaker: Sheldon
00:11:19:230000.Dialogue: Because I am without friends. Like the proverbial cheese, I stand alone. Even while seated.

00:11:27:080000.Scene: The university cafeteria. The guys have shaved and had haircuts. Howard has kept his moustache.
00:11:27:080000.Speaker: Leonard
00:11:27:080000.Dialogue: Come on. We said we were sorry.

00:11:29:070000.Scene: The university cafeteria. The guys have shaved and had haircuts. Howard has kept his moustache.
00:11:29:070000.Speaker: Sheldon
00:11:29:070000.Dialogue: It's going to take more than an "I'm sorry" and a store-bought apology pie from Penny to make up for what you've done to me.

00:11:36:190000.Scene: The university cafeteria. The guys have shaved and had haircuts. Howard has kept his moustache.
00:11:36:190000.Speaker: Kripke
00:11:36:190000.Dialogue: Read your retraction email. Way to destroy your reputation.

00:11:41:160000.Scene: The university cafeteria. The guys have shaved and had haircuts. Howard has kept his moustache.
00:11:41:160000.Speaker: Sheldon
00:11:41:160000.Dialogue: You see? People have been pointing and laughing at me all morning.

00:11:45:080000.Scene: The university cafeteria. The guys have shaved and had haircuts. Howard has kept his moustache.
00:11:45:080000.Speaker: Kripke
00:11:45:080000.Dialogue: That's not true. People have been pointing and laughing at you your whole life.

00:11:50:060000.Scene: The university cafeteria. The guys have shaved and had haircuts. Howard has kept his moustache.
00:11:50:060000.Speaker: Sheldon
00:11:50:060000.Dialogue: I've had enough. Attention, everyone. I'm Dr. Sheldon Cooper. As many of you in the physics department might know, my career trajectory has taken a minor detour.

00:12:00:020000.Scene: The university cafeteria. The guys have shaved and had haircuts. Howard has kept his moustache.
00:12:00:020000.Speaker: Kripke

00:12:03:120000.Scene: The university cafeteria. The guys have shaved and had haircuts. Howard has kept his moustache.
00:12:03:120000.Speaker: Sheldon
00:12:03:120000.Dialogue: My credibility may have been damaged...

00:12:05:100000.Scene: The university cafeteria. The guys have shaved and had haircuts. Howard has kept his moustache.
00:12:05:100000.Speaker: Kripke

00:12:06:160000.Scene: The university cafeteria. The guys have shaved and had haircuts. Howard has kept his moustache.
00:12:06:160000.Speaker: Sheldon
00:12:06:160000.Dialogue: But I would like to remind you that in science, there's no such thing as failure. There once was a man who referred to his prediction of a cosmological constant as the single "biggest blunder" of his career. That man's name was... surprise, surprise... Albert Einstein.

00:12:24:230000.Scene: The university cafeteria. The guys have shaved and had haircuts. Howard has kept his moustache.
00:12:24:230000.Speaker: Kripke
00:12:24:230000.Dialogue: Yeah, but research into dark energy proved that Einstein's cosmological constant was actually right all along, so you're still... surprise, surprise... A loser.

00:12:37:140000.Scene: The university cafeteria. The guys have shaved and had haircuts. Howard has kept his moustache.
00:12:37:140000.Speaker: Sheldon
00:12:37:140000.Dialogue: You think you're so clever. Let me just tell you, while I do not currently have a scathing retort, you check your e-mail periodically for a doozy.

00:12:50:170000.Scene: The university cafeteria. The guys have shaved and had haircuts. Howard has kept his moustache.
00:12:50:170000.Speaker: Leonard
00:12:50:170000.Dialogue: So much for our friendship with Sheldon.

00:12:54:170000.Scene: The university cafeteria. The guys have shaved and had haircuts. Howard has kept his moustache.
00:12:54:170000.Speaker: Raj
00:12:54:170000.Dialogue: We'll always have the night the heat went out.

00:13:05:070000.Speaker: Leonard
00:13:05:070000.Dialogue: Since we got interrupted last night, I didn't have a chance to give you this.

00:13:19:120000.Speaker: Leonard
00:13:19:120000.Dialogue: It's a snowflake. From the North Pole.

00:13:25:190000.Speaker: Leonard
00:13:25:190000.Dialogue: It's eternal. I preserved it in a one percent solution of polyvinyl acetal resin.

00:13:35:040000.Speaker: Penny
00:13:35:040000.Dialogue: That's the most romantic thing anyone's ever said to me that I didn't understand.

00:13:40:100000.Speaker: Leonard
00:13:40:100000.Dialogue: It's actually a simple process. Cyanoacrylates are monomers which polymerize on...

00:13:49:110000.Speaker: Howard
00:13:49:110000.Dialogue: Red alert, Leonard. Sheldon ran away.

00:13:51:090000.Speaker: Leonard
00:13:51:090000.Dialogue: Man, I cannot catch a break.

00:13:54:120000.Speaker: Penny
00:13:54:120000.Dialogue: So, how do you know he ran away?

00:13:56:100000.Speaker: Howard
00:13:56:100000.Dialogue: Well, he's not answering his phone, he handed in his resignation at the university and he sent me a text that said, "I'm running away."

00:14:05:230000.Speaker: Penny
00:14:05:230000.Dialogue: Aren't you going to do something?

00:14:08:100000.Speaker: Leonard
00:14:08:100000.Dialogue: Of course I'm going to do something. Howard, you check the comic book store. Raj, go to the thai restaurant. I'll stay here with Penny in her apartment.

00:14:18:130000.Speaker: Leonard
00:14:18:130000.Dialogue: Oh, damn it. It's Sheldon's mother. A break cannot be caught. Hi, Mrs. Cooper. He is? Sheldon went home to Texas. Yeah, no, I know he resigned. I guess it kind of is our fault. No, you're right. Someone needs to come talk to him. Don't worry, I'll take care of it. All right. New plan. Howard, you and Raj go to Texas. I'll stay with Penny in her apartment.

00:14:51:170000.Speaker: Penny
00:14:51:170000.Dialogue: You're not gonna go with them?

00:14:53:060000.Speaker: Leonard
00:14:53:060000.Dialogue: Well, you know, I gave you the snowflake and we were kissing and... Come on, I don't want to go to Texas!

00:15:00:120000.Speaker: Howard
00:15:00:120000.Dialogue: Oh, right, and I do? My people already crossed a desert once. We're done.

00:15:08:050000.Speaker: Leonard
00:15:08:050000.Dialogue: Trust me, you'll be fine. See ya.

00:15:10:080000.Speaker: Penny
00:15:10:080000.Dialogue: Well, wait a second, Leonard. Come on, how can you not go? He's your best friend.

00:15:14:070000.Speaker: Leonard
00:15:14:070000.Dialogue: Yeah, but I already saw him naked. Just come here.

00:15:17:220000.Speaker: Penny
00:15:17:220000.Dialogue: I promise I will be here when you get back. Just go help Sheldon.

00:15:22:160000.Speaker: Penny
00:15:22:160000.Dialogue: - Yeah. We waited a few months. We can wait a few more days.

00:15:38:110000.Speaker: Raj
00:15:38:110000.Dialogue: Boy, you cannot catch a break, can you?

00:15:50:010000.Speaker: Mrs Cooper
00:15:50:010000.Dialogue: Hold your horses, young man. Here in Texas, we pray before we eat.

00:15:55:030000.Speaker: Mrs Cooper
00:15:55:030000.Dialogue: This is not California, land of the heathen.

00:15:59:150000.Speaker: Mrs Cooper
00:15:59:150000.Dialogue: Gimme. By His hand we are all...

00:16:13:080000.Speaker: Mrs Cooper
00:16:13:080000.Dialogue: - Please know that we are truly...

00:16:22:200000.Speaker: Mrs Cooper
00:16:22:200000.Dialogue: Now, that wasn't so hard, was it?

00:16:25:080000.Speaker: Sheldon
00:16:25:080000.Dialogue: My objection was based on considerations other than difficulty.

00:16:34:210000.Speaker: Sheldon
00:16:34:210000.Dialogue: Thank you for carving a smiley face in my grilled cheese sandwich.

00:16:37:140000.Speaker: Mrs Cooper
00:16:37:140000.Dialogue: Oh, I know how to take care of my baby. His eyes came out a little thin, but you can just pretend he's Chinese.

00:16:48:220000.Speaker: Mrs Cooper
00:16:48:220000.Dialogue: So, do you want to talk about what happened with you and your little friends?

00:16:54:060000.Speaker: Mrs Cooper
00:16:54:060000.Dialogue: - All right. If you recall, when you were little, we sat right here at this very spot and we talked about the problems you had getting along with the neighbor kids.

00:17:07:110000.Speaker: Sheldon
00:17:07:110000.Dialogue: That was different. They were threatened by my intelligence and too stupid to know that's why they hated me.

00:17:15:190000.Speaker: Mrs Cooper
00:17:15:190000.Dialogue: Oh baby, they knew very well why they hated you.

00:17:30:090000.Speaker: Leonard
00:17:30:090000.Dialogue: I can't believe you bought a red cowboy hat.

00:17:32:230000.Speaker: Howard
00:17:32:230000.Dialogue: Hello? I'm wearing a red turtleneck.

00:17:40:030000.Speaker: Howard
00:17:40:030000.Dialogue: Plus, it was the only boys' large they had.

00:17:44:160000.Speaker: Raj
00:17:44:160000.Dialogue: I'm sorry, this does not look like Texas. Where's the tumbleweeds? Whe's the saloons?

00:17:50:050000.Speaker: Raj
00:17:50:050000.Dialogue: Like in the movies I saw growing up in India. You know, Four for Texas, Yellow Rose of Texas.

00:17:55:070000.Speaker: Howard
00:17:55:070000.Dialogue: This neighborhood is more Texas Chainsaw Massacre.

00:18:00:030000.Speaker: Raj
00:18:00:030000.Dialogue: I was really hoping to see a cattle drive.

00:18:02:080000.Speaker: Leonard
00:18:02:080000.Dialogue: What can I tell you? They probably have steaks on sale at that big-ass Costco over there.

00:18:16:150000.Speaker: Leonard
00:18:16:150000.Dialogue: Will you please take that stupid hat off?

00:18:19:030000.Speaker: Howard
00:18:19:030000.Dialogue: No, I want to blend in.

00:18:29:080000.Speaker: Mrs Cooper
00:18:29:080000.Dialogue: Howdy to you, too. You got here quick.

00:18:38:150000.Speaker: Howard
00:18:38:150000.Dialogue: If y'all don't mind, I got a hankerin' for a Lone Star beer.

00:18:44:070000.Speaker: Mrs Cooper
00:18:44:070000.Dialogue: There's no alcohol in this household. Stop talking like that and lose the hat.

00:18:50:110000.Speaker: Howard
00:18:50:110000.Dialogue: Sorry. I'll take a diet Yoo-Hoo if you have it.

00:18:54:160000.Speaker: Mrs Cooper
00:18:54:160000.Dialogue: You'll take a cola. What about you? Radge, isn't it? You still having trouble talking to the ladies? Because, at our church, we have a woman who's an amazing healer. Mostly she does crutch and wheelchair people, but I bet she'd be willing to take a shot at whatever Third World demon is running around inside of you.

00:19:17:180000.Speaker: Leonard
00:19:17:180000.Dialogue: If you don't mind, there's a 3:05 nonstop back to Los Angeles and you have no idea how much I want to be on it.

00:19:26:210000.Speaker: Mrs Cooper
00:19:26:210000.Dialogue: Oh, good. I been praying for you.

00:19:55:050000.Speaker: Mrs Cooper
00:19:55:050000.Dialogue: You watch your mouth, Shelly. Everyone's entitled to their opinion.

00:19:59:220000.Speaker: Sheldon
00:19:59:220000.Dialogue: Evolution isn't an opinion, it's fact.

00:20:08:190000.Speaker: Sheldon
00:20:08:190000.Dialogue: I forgive you. Let's go home.

00:20:15:150000.Speaker: Mrs Cooper
00:20:15:150000.Dialogue: Don't tell me prayer doesn't work.

00:20:24:100000.Speaker: Leonard
00:20:24:100000.Dialogue: How about that? I finally caught a break.

00:20:33:020000.Speaker: Leonard
00:20:33:020000.Dialogue: You know how they say when friends have sex, it can get weird?

00:20:39:190000.Speaker: Leonard
00:20:39:190000.Dialogue: Why does it have to get weird?

00:20:44:100000.Speaker: Leonard
00:20:44:100000.Dialogue: I mean, we were friends, and now we're more than friends. We're whatever "this" is. But why label it, right? I mean... It is what it is and...
